prompt.text: Hi, [NAME].
Nice to meet you, [NAME].
Howdy, [NAME]!
Hello, [NAME]!
Hello! I'm [AGENT NAME]. Take a minute to introduce yourselves. Go ahead and chat a little more if you have extra time. :-)
Great! Now, share one reason why you are pursuing a WGU degree.
For further information about WGU Academy, FAQs, and more, please visit: https://academy.wgu.edu/.
Okay! Let's begin.

Welcome to WGU Academy. :-) Like our regular degree programs, courses in WGU Academy are entirely self-paced. YOU study on your own, and YOU decide when you're ready to tackle assessments. That's the beauty of competency-based education!

All WGU Academy courses are transferable to WGU, and you are guaranteed admission to WGU upon completion of your minimum requirements. Take a look at Nancy's testimonial on the right. A WGU degree helped her become a principal!
Please pick a category using the format: category + value. For example, type: "English Composition for 100." Your time for this activity starts now!
Ask me for another category please.
You're on your own.
You can still receive payment by going to this link and entering your email address
That's all we have time for! Please share something you learned during this game inspired by Jeopardy! :)
Hi, [NAME].
Nice to meet you, [NAME].
Howdy, [NAME]!
Hello, [NAME]!

Now for the main event... let's play a game inspired by Jeopardy! This game is meant to serve as a way to get to know each other a little better and to learn more about WGU. Some of the questions in this game will be related to English Composition, and others will be about WGU as a whole! Let's begin. :-)
Now for the main event... let's play a game inspired by Jeopardy!
Great job! I hope you both enjoyed that as much as I did. Nothing like a little friendly competition! ;-)
Completing your English assignments in a timely manner and working toward completing each portion of your funnel will set you up for success.

At WGU Academy, we like to set SMARTER goals. "SMARTER" stands for: Specific, Measurable, Actionable, Relevant, Time-Bound, Evaluate, and Reward. | By setting SMARTER goals, we are setting ourselves up for success to fill in each piece of our pie. For example, instead of saying "I will do well in my English course," try setting a SMARTER goal such as "I will complete my Personal Narrative assignment in 1 week by setting aside one hour each evening to work on it. Along the way, I will evaluate my progress, and when I finish, I will celebrate with my family!"
https://forms.gle/LoH4qHHTG2paKWeA8
Take a moment to share what your next assignment is in your English Composition class.
IMPORTANT: Please copy and paste the following Google Forms link into a new window or tab and fill out the form to mark your attendance for this activity.

Now, take 3 minutes to take turns sharing SMARTER goals for completing your next assignment. Make sure they follow the acronym of Specific, Measurable, Actionable, Relevant, Time-Bound, Evaluate, and Reward! If you are not sure if your goals follow the SMARTER template, ask your partner!
Take a few minutes to assess each other's goals. Do each of the goals follow the SMARTER steps? How can your goals be improved? How can you help each other with your goals?

If you'd like, please share your email address, social media, or phone number with each other to keep in contact after this activity. Your personal information will not be used in any way outside of this conversation.

In your English Composition class, each of your assignments is one piece of a larger funnel that leads into your goal of graduating from Academy and ultimately enrolling at WGU. All of your assignments are required to complete this course, and this course is required to complete WGU Academy. Upon completion of WGU Academy, you are guaranteed admission to WGU! | With that being said, it is crucial to keep up with your assignments and set short-term goals to work towards your larger long-term career goals.

Take a moment to share with your partner which degree program you are pursuing, and brainstorm which ingredients will set you up for success. Which ingredients do you have in common? Which ingredients are different?

In this game, you will be prompted with a clue that represents an answer. Your job is to give the corresponding question! For example, upon picking a category and point value, you will receive something like this: "This university is the largest fully-online nonprofit university in the country." |Then... You will answer with the question! In this case, it should be: "What is WGU?", or you may simply type: "WGU". Please alternate turns to give everyone an equal chance to play. Only the person who asks for the question will be given points for an answer.
I will share images to the whiteboard to help/guide you
Now I'll start an interactive dialogue.
Welcome! I'm [AGENT NAME]. I'm here to have an interactive dialogue with you to assist you in your programming task.
(You can trigger the same tutorial dynamically by talking about animals - see dialogues/dialogues-example.xml and dictionaries/animals.txt for details)
Note that other agent behaviors (like accountable-talk style listening) will be suppressed while the dialogue is underway.
